title: What do you consider 'good FPS'?

reply_to.body: Wait.. what? I dont get it, if your monitor doesn't display anything above 60.. how can you get 100 FPS? o.O
reply_to.body_tagged: Wait.. what? I dont get it, if your monitor doesn't display anything above 60.. how can you get 100 FPS? o.O

replies.body:
People say that you can't see the difference between 120 fps and 60 fps. I find 120 fps is smoother and here is why I think that is. The human eye can see 50-60 fps but is not a precise MS count between each "photo". So a 60 fps rate would stutter slightly with your eyes as I said because it's not to the MS accurate. 120 fps would mean more updates thus having a smoother appearance even if your eyes can only see 50-60fps. Understand now?

So I say 120 fps if your monitor can display that fast. (mine can)
replies.body_tagged:
People say that you can't see the difference between 120 fps and 60 fps. I find 120 fps is smoother and here is why I think that is. The human eye can see 50-60 fps but is not a precise MS count between each "photo". So a 60 fps rate would stutter slightly with your eyes as I said because it's not to the MS accurate. 120 fps would mean more updates thus having a smoother appearance even if your eyes can only see 50-60fps. Understand now?

So I say 120 fps if your monitor can display that fast. (mine can)

60+ is very stable and is very good for PvPing.

I normally play at 15-25 FPS.
